definition: to fill a gap (e.g. a gap in knowledge or blank space in a print layout)/to make some additional remarks/filler (in a newspaper or magazine)
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: My essay just about reached the necessary word count, but there's an awful lot of filler text in there.
sentences.chinese: 我的文章剛剛湊夠字數，但裏面有一篇糟糕的補白。
只是一篇補白，僅此而已。

sentences.english: Second, specific padding out of nothing.
sentences.chinese: 第二，具體補白，無中生有。
